intro: Rhabdothamnopsis sinensis, commonly known as the Chinese spurge, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in a cup-like structure called a cyathium. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Rhabdothamnopsis sinensis is often used in traditional medicine and has ornamental value due to its unique appearance.
